head.title: A Sale Just in Time To Update the Living Room

hedline.hl1: A Sale Just in Time To Update the Living Room

abstract.p: Modern furniture floor sample sale at MoMA Design Store in SoHo noted; photo (S)

block.p: In the market for modern furniture at bargain prices? A floor sample sale at the MoMA Design Store in SoHo begins on Jan. 31 and continues through Feb. 9. Folding chairs by Breuer in chrome and leather, originally $1,285, will be $749.95, and the Fritz stool, made by Rexite in gray plastic, previously $225, will be on sale for $89.95.

In the market for modern furniture at bargain prices? A floor sample sale at the MoMA Design Store in SoHo begins on Jan. 31 and continues through Feb. 9. Folding chairs by Breuer in chrome and leather, originally $1,285, will be $749.95, and the Fritz stool, made by Rexite in gray plastic, previously $225, will be on sale for $89.95.

Pod wall lamps by Ayala Serfaty in hot pink or orange felt are $43.95, marked down from $150; the George Nelson ball clock (above) was $250 and will be $100; and there will be a few pieces from designers like Le Corbusier, in addition to wool area rugs and designer CD towers. The MoMA Design Store is at 81 Spring Street (Crosby Street); (646) 613-1367.
Tips on secret sources and good deals should be sent to rohrlich@nytimes.com.
